abstract: NFL Roundup; New York Giants general manager Jerry Reese goes on spending spree, committing about $204 million in contracts for defensive players as NFL's off-season free agency period begins; other football news noted.
lead_paragraph: In a 24-hour period, Giants General Manager Jerry Reese committed about $204 million in contracts for defensive players, with $114 million of that sum guaranteed to be paid out.

headline.main: Shopping Spree Shores Up Defense, but Giants Have Plenty of Holes to Fill
headline.print_headline: Giants’ Spending Spree Gives Defense a Boost

snippet: In a 24-hour period, Giants General Manager Jerry Reese committed about $204 million in contracts for defensive players, with $114 million of that sum guaranteed to be paid out.
